features.title: Powerful Features

features.detailedReportDesc: Shows before/after space comparison and file statistics

useCases.title: When Do You Need Kiro Cleaner?
useCases.subtitle: Scenarios where Kiro Cleaner is useful
useCases.case1Scenario: üìå When Kiro IDE responds slowly and lags severely
useCases.case1Solution: Large local cache is the main cause! After cleaning redundant data, IDE takes off immediately with significantly improved response speed.
useCases.case2Scenario: üìå When your disk space is running low
useCases.case2Solution: Kiro Cleaner can clean conversation history, cache, and temporary files to free up large amounts of storage space.
useCases.case3Scenario: üìå When you switch between multiple projects
useCases.case3Solution: Regular cleanup can avoid project data confusion and keep IDE running smoothly.
useCases.case4Scenario: üìå When you use Kiro IDE for a long time
useCases.case4Solution: Regular maintenance can prevent data accumulation and avoid performance degradation.

installation.precompiledComment1: # Download pre-compiled binary for your OS from Releases page

faq.title: What You Might Want to Know
faq.subtitle: Frequently asked questions about Kiro Cleaner
faq.q1: Kiro IDE is lagging, does cleanup really help?
faq.a1: Very helpful! When local cache is too large, Kiro IDE will obviously slow down and lag. After using Kiro Cleaner to clean redundant data, IDE response speed will significantly improve and take off immediately!
faq.q2: Will Kiro Cleaner delete my important data?
faq.a2: No! Kiro Cleaner only cleans cache, temporary files, and old conversation records. Important data like configuration files and current projects will not be touched. Plus, automatic backup is created before cleanup, so you can restore anytime.
faq.q3: Can Kiro IDE still work normally after cleanup?
faq.a3: Absolutely! Kiro Cleaner only cleans redundant data and does not affect IDE's normal operation. After cleanup, IDE will run faster and more smoothly.
faq.a4: It depends on usage frequency. If you use Kiro IDE daily, it's recommended to clean once a week; if usage is less frequent, clean once a month. You can also clean when you notice IDE slowing down.
faq.a5: Kiro Cleaner supports macOS, Windows, and Linux. As long as you can run Kiro IDE, you can use Kiro Cleaner.
faq.a6: If you used the --backup parameter during cleanup, a backup will be automatically created. You can use the 'kiro-cleaner backup restore' command to restore data. It's recommended to always use the backup feature.
faq.contactDesc: Feel free to submit an Issue on GitHub or join our community discussion
